channel.title: NPR Topics: Education
channel.description: We've been to school. We know how education works. Right? In fact, many aspects of learning — in homes, at schools, at work and elsewhere — are evolving rapidly, along with our understanding of learning. Join us as we explore how learning happens.

item.title: How college campus security has changed to prepare for violent attacks
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rob Kilfoyle, president of the International Association of Campus Law Enforcement Administrators, about evolving safety standards on college campuses.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rob Kilfoyle, president of the International Association of Campus Law Enforcement Administrators, about evolving safety standards on college campuses.

item.title: Teachers are using software to see if students used AI. What happens when it's wrong?
item.description: School districts from Utah to Ohio to Alabama are spending thousands of dollars on these tools, despite research showing the technology is far from reliable.

item.title: Brown University shooting victims identified; the gunman remains at large
item.description: The two students killed in the attack at Brown University are MukhammadAziz Umurzokov,18, and Ella Cook, 19. The shooter was still at large as of Monday afternoon, police said.

item.title: Test scores in U.S. schools are down. Are smartphones to blame?
item.description: Researchers are examining whether a decline in reading and math scores over the last decade is related to the widespread use of smartphones by young people.

item.title: Why a record number of students applied for federal financial aid this year
item.description: Thousands of high school seniors are filling out their federal financial aid form or FAFSA. Numbers show a record increase in applications despite confidence in higher ed being at a low.

item.title: 1 student dead, 1 critically injured in shooting at Kentucky State University
item.description: Classes and campus activities were canceled for the rest of the week after a shooting that police said left one student dead and another in critical condition. Police said a suspect who is not a KSU student was in custody.

item.title: Millions of borrowers in Biden's SAVE plan would start paying under new settlement
item.description: Legal challenges put SAVE borrowers in limbo for months, a time during which they were not required to make payments on their loans. That would change if the proposed settlement is approved.
